Name: Clams in White Bean Sauce
Description: No need to prep everything ahead: Get your chopping in while the fennel cooks. Just keep an eye on the pot!

Name: Brassicas Bowl
Description: Don’t skimp on the seeds—lots of crunchy bits throughout keep this salad recipe texturally interesting.

Name: Turmeric-Ginger Chicken Soup
Description: Chicken noodle soup never gets old. If you don’t have udon for this recipe, use rice noodles or regular old spaghetti. A small knob of fresh turmeric can replace the dried type.

Name: Curried Yellow Split Pea Soup With Spiced Coconut
Description: If you have extra time, double the amount of vegetables for this split pea soup recipe, then scoop out half of the soffritto and freeze it for a shortcut another night.

Name: Cheesesteaks
Description: Look for short ribs with the most marbling possible for these cheesesteaks; if you really want to splash out, use boneless rib eye.

Name: Mirror Cake Glaze
Description: This creamy white-chocolate glaze sets with a mirror-like shine when poured over a smoothly frosted cake. For a gorgeous marbled effect, layer several colors of glaze into one bowl before pouring it over the cake.

Name: Beef Pho
Description: This quick version of the classic Vietnamese soup is steeped with aromatic spices and finished off with a waft of refreshing herbs.

Name: Miso Harissa Delicata Squash and Brussels Sprouts Salad
Description: I love this combination of flavors in the cold months when winter squash and Brussels are available at the farm, though the miso-harissa dressing that brings it all together is lovely year-round.

Name: Carne Asada Cheese Fries
Description: Meet the love child of cheese fries and nachos: crispy, seasoned fries loaded with skirt steak and silky cheese sauce. One taste and you'll understand why San Diego is so wild about them.

Name: Slow-Cooker Green Chicken Chili
Description: This easy, slow-cooked chili is not your average "bowl of red." With chicken, sweet potatoes, tomatillo salsa, and pinto beans, it's more of a cross between chile verde (usually made with pork) and white chicken chili. Just a few ingredients and effortless prep gives you a flavorful and satisfying "bowl of green."

Name: Flourless Cacao Fudge Cake
Description: Raw cacao powder retains a higher portion of nutrients than more common cocoa powder, which is usually heated during manufacturing. Swap the almond meal here for hazelnut meal, if you prefer.

Name: 3-Ingredient Cheese Sauce
Description: This velvety-smooth sauce uses real cheddar (not the processed stuff) and comes together in less than 10 minutes. Serve as is with chips, fries, or chili dogs, or transform it into the best queso you've ever had (see below for more on that). Pro tip: Skip the aged cheddar from the fancy cheese counter—the sauce will be even creamier with a block of no-frills cheddar from the dairy aisle of the supermarket.

Name: Classic Chicken Pho
Description: Easier to make than the beef version, chicken pho requires fewer ingredients and takes less finesse for superlative results.

Name: Brigadeiros
Description: Somewhere between a fudgy chocolate truffle and a Tootsie Roll is the Brazilian confection known as the brigadeiro.

Name: Spiced Chocolate Molasses Buttons
Description: This cookie gets a double hit of raw sugars: sticky dark muscovado in the dough and a roll through turbinado sugar that adds crunch and a naturally glittering finish around a puddle of bittersweet chocolate ganache.

Name: Kale, Snow Pea, and Pork Dumplings
Description: Snow peas and water chestnuts add a fresh crunch to these tasty dumplings

Name: Pan-Fried Sea Bass With Miso, Lemon, and Thyme-Glazed Roasties
Description: A tangy dish full of zing. The thyme adds deep flavour and the roasties give real crunch.
